availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Jeffries (Clark County, Kentucky, clerk)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Smith Jeffries. Married to Mary F. Ramsey Jeffries in Winchester, Clark County, Kentucky on September 27, 1862. Father of Maddie Jeffries and Samuel Jeffries. Clerk in Clark County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 873.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 346B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 131B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 459A..
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film #001943687, p.56.
